p: Unlike the Eastern Europe scenario ( Table 1), where the backyard network of farms with low-level of biosecurity was the main reason for the local ASF transmission, and the transfer of food products was the probable cause of long-distance infection ( 84), in the Northern Europe scenario, the wild boar population played the main epidemiological role ( 11, 85). The main risk factor facilitating the persistence of infection in Northern Europe was the contamination of the forest areas where the infected carcasses of dead wild boars lay for many months ( 23).
